addToGroup-downloadLabel.string: Create Excel document with account names, e.g. using this empty template:

addToGroup-givenNamePlaceholder.developer_comment: Placeholder for given name text input

addToGroup-hideList.string: READ LESS ON HOW TO ADD ACCOUNTS

addToGroup-importLabel.string: Create accounts from selected Excel document:

addToGroup-list1Item1.string: Enter the given name and surname for each account, one at a time.

addToGroup-list1Item2.string: Write the name so that you can distinguish the identity of the person even if there are identical names e.g. by adding an initial. It is not allowed to use personal ID numbers for this use.

addToGroup-list1Item3.string: When you click the ADD button the account will be added to the organisation with a created username and password and appearing in a table below in the "Manage added accounts" section, where the newly added accounts will be pre-selected.

addToGroup-list1Item4.string: transfer it to an external system of your choice, e.g. by exporting to Excel or copying, as you will not be able to retrieve the same password afterwards, and it will only be visible during this logged in session and page load.

addToGroup-list1Item4Strong.string: Then note the corresponding EPPN/username and password which appears in the table

addToGroup-list2Item1.string: Create a 2-column Excel-document containing the given names and surnames of the accounts you wish to add. You can download the example file to fill in using the DOWNLOAD DOCUMENT link.

addToGroup-list2Item2.string: Import your filled in document by clicking on the SELECT DOCUMENT button to choose your .xls or .xlsx file. You will see the name of the last imported file next to the button.

addToGroup-list2Item3.string: Then create the accounts listed in the document by clicking on the CREATE ACCOUNTS button. The accounts will be added to the organisation, with usernames and passwords, and appearing in a table below in the "Manage added accounts" section, where the newly added accounts will be pre-selected.

addToGroup-list2Item4.string: transfer it to an external system of your choice, e.g. by exporting to another Excel document or copying, as you will not be able to retrieve the same password afterwards, and it will only be visible during this logged in session and page load.

addToGroup-list2Item4Strong.string: Then note the corresponding EPPN/username and password which appears in the table

addToGroup-ninValidation.string: It is not allowed to save a national ID number.

addToGroup-paragraph.string: Add every account, either by first importing your prepared Excel-document or one by one using the form.

addToGroup-showList.string: READ MORE ON HOW TO ADD ACCOUNTS

excel-file-rowIndex-error.string: Excel file contains errors in row {row}.

intro-lead.string: In the forms below you can manage your organisations accounts by adding students, to create their individual account with a unique username - EPPN - and the password that they will need to be able to perform the Digital National Exam.

intro-leadEmphasis.string: The contents can be presented in Swedish or English, choose language in the footer of this web page. You are advised to use the service in a larger browser window, i.e. not mobile device, for legibility and to read the full instructions under the READ MORE... links. If you are managing accounts for the first time, or many at once, it may take some time until complete.

landing-header.string: Welcome to Managed Accounts with eduID

landing-info.string: This is a product development of eduID as part of Sunet's government assignment to assist Skolverket with digital identity regarding the digital national exam and assessment support, by offering school principals in need thereof an IdP or e-identity.

landing-paragraph-1.string: To manage your organisation you first need to log in.

landing-paragraph-2.string: Continue by pressing the link below to log in at your appropriate service, after which you will automatically be redirected back to this service, to start managing your account.

manageGroup-generateNewPasswordDialogPar.string: Are you sure you want to generate a new password for {name}? If so, please press the OK button below.

manageGroup-hideList.string: READ LESS ON HOW TO MANAGE ADDED ACCOUNTS

manageGroup-listItem1.string: You can select accounts by using the corresponding checkbox for each row, one by one or all. Note: the accounts added in the current session - with a retrievable password, are pre-selected.

manageGroup-listItem2.string: You can export all selected accounts to a new Excel file by clicking DOWNLOAD EXCEL, to save or edit locally.

manageGroup-listItem3.string: You can copy several/all entire selected rows at once using the COPY ROW button, you can also copy the entire row or copy just the individual EPPN/username with the copy icon next to it. When copying and exporting, the full scope will be included as the username, not just the EPPN.

manageGroup-listItem4.string: If you get a new password by clicking the NEW PASSWORD link, it must be used by the account holder (i.e. by the student for the exam), as the previous password will be invalid.

manageGroup-listItem5.string: If you need to make changes to added accounts, select the appropriate row/s and click the REMOVE ROW button, you can now add the account again if needed, in the same way - but with a new EPPN/username and password.

manageGroup-listItem6.string: To find an account you can sort the table by entry-order or names, use the pagination arrows underneath or show the entire table by clicking the SHOW ALL button, if your table is spanning several pages.

manageGroup-paragraph.string: Export, copy or note down the corresponding EPPN/username and password for every account during the session and page load in which it was added.

manageGroup-removeMembersDialogParagraph.string: Are you sure you want to delete {selectedMemberLength} accounts? If so, please press the OK button below.

manageGroup-showList.string: READ MORE ON HOW TO MANAGE ADDED ACCOUNTS

not found paragraph.string: We can't find what you are looking for. This may be due to a technical error or a typo. Please try again or use the link to move forward.
